intro: Silene andersonii, commonly known as Anderson's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Silene andersonii is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to plant biodiversity.
